Docs.param: the position in seq following the code point that should be returned.
the index of the first element in seq.
Docs.summary: Returns the code point that precedes the index in the specified array of character units and is not less than start.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if the index <= start, start , index is greater than the length of seq, or if start is equal or greater than the length of seq.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int CodePointCount (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int beginIndex, int endIndex);
.method public static hidebysig int32 CodePointCount(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 beginIndex, int32 endIndex) cil managed
static member CodePointCount : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int * int -> int

Docs.param: the inclusive index to begin counting at.
the exclusive index to stop counting at.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of Unicode code points in the subsequence of the specified character sequence, as delineated by beginIndex and endIndex.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if beginIndex , beginIndex > endIndex or if endIndex is greater than the length of seq.

.method public static hidebysig int32 CodePointCount(char[] a, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: the inclusive index to begin counting at.
the number of char values to look through in seq.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of Unicode code points in the subsequence of the specified char array, as delineated by offset and count.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if offset , count or if offset + count is greater than the length of seq.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed
static member OffsetByCodePoints : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int * int -> int

Docs.param: the character sequence to find the index in.
the number of code points to look backwards or forwards; may be a negative or positive value.
Docs.summary: Determines the index in the specified character sequence that is offset codePointOffset code points from index.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if index , index is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forwards or backwards (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (char[] a, int start, int count, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(char[] a, int32 start, int32 count, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed
static member OffsetByCodePoints : char[] * int * int * int * int -> int

Docs.param: the inclusive index that marks the beginning of the subsequence.
the number of char values to include within the subsequence.
the start index in the subsequence of the char array.
the number of code points to look backwards or forwards; may be a negative or positive value.
Docs.summary: Determines the index in a subsequence of the specified character array that is offset codePointOffset code points from index.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.

if start , count , index , index > start + count, start + count is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forward or backward (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char[] ToChars(int32 codePoint) cil managed

Docs.param: the Unicode code point to encode.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and returns it as a char array.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int ToChars (int codePoint, char[] dst, int dstIndex);
.method public static hidebysig int32 ToChars(int32 codePoint, char[] dst, int32 dstIndex) cil managed
static member ToChars : int * char[] * int -> int

Docs.param: the Unicode code point to encode.
the destination array to copy the encoded value into.
the index in dst from where to start copying.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and copies the value(s) into the char array dst, starting at index dstIndex.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.
if dst is null.
if dstIndex is negative, greater than or equal to dst.length or equals dst.length - 1 when codePoint is a .
